info.title: dotNetRDF SHACL service
info.description:
This application exposes a [SHACL](https://www.w3.org/TR/shacl/) procecssor that can check conformance and validate data graphs against shapes graphs.

It's implemented using the [dotNetRDF](https://github.com/dotnetrdf/dotnetrdf) library. A [pull request](https://github.com/dotnetrdf/dotnetrdf/pull/236) has been merged.

The processor is fully compliant with SHACL Core and SHACL-SPARQL. An [EARL](https://www.w3.org/TR/EARL10-Schema/) implementation report has been [submitted](https://github.com/w3c/data-shapes/blob/gh-pages/data-shapes-test-suite/reports/dotnetrdf-shacl-earl.ttl).

The service supports [CORS](https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/).

[A web form version](http://langsamu.net/shacl/validate) is also available.

### Usage
- Input graphs are specified as either request body, query string parameters or form parameters.
- Request body takes precedence over parameters.
- When using parameters (not request body), input graphs can be given as either URIs or RDF.
- URI parameters take precedence over RDF parameters.
- When using request body, data graph and shapes graph must both be in the same graph.
- Input graph serialisation format is auto-detected.
  - For RDF parameters the format is chosen based on heuristics by dotNetRDF's [`StringParser`](https://github.com/dotnetrdf/dotnetrdf/blob/2d8c65f9fd49d8d90e9eedabe709631f99e06207/Libraries/dotNetRDF/Parsing/StringParser.cs#L84-L97).
  - For URI parameters the format is chosen based on the response Content-Type header by dotNetRDF's [`MimeTypeHelper`](https://github.com/dotnetrdf/dotnetrdf/blob/2d8c65f9fd49d8d90e9eedabe709631f99e06207/Libraries/dotNetRDF/Core/MIMETypesHelper.cs).
- Output graph serialisation format is controlled by the Accept request header. Supported ouput formats:
  - `text/html`: RDFa (default)
  - `text/turtle`: Turtle
  - `application/n-triples`: N-Triples
  - `application/ld+json`: JSON-LD
  - `application/rdf+xml`: RDF/XML
  - `application/rdf+json`: RDF/JSON
- An optional `format` parameter can be used to override output format. Supported 'extensions':
  - `html`: RDFa
  - `ttl`: Turtle
  - `nt`: N-Triples
  - `json`: JSON-LD
  - `xml`: RDF/XML
  - `rj`: RDF/JSON

validate.description: An RDF document representing the SHACL validation report graph result.

text/html.example:
Conforms
False
Results
  • Focus node
    http://example.com/s
    Path
    http://example.com/p
    Value
    http://example.com/o
    Shape
    http://example.com/shape
    Source constraint component
    sh:PatternConstraintComponent
    Severity
    sh:Violation

application/rdf+xml.example:
<rdf:RDF xml:base="http://example.com" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#" xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#">
  <ValidationReport>
    <result>
      <ValidationResult>
        <focusNode resource="s" />
        <resultPath resource="p" />
        <value resource="o" />
        <sourceShape resource="shape" />
        <resultSeverity resource="http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#Violation" />
        <sourceConstraintComponent resource="http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#PatternConstraintComponent" />
      </ValidationResult>
    </result>
  </ValidationReport>
</rdf:RDF>

text/html.example:
<dl typeof="sh:ValidationReport" prefix="sh: http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl# xsd: http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#" lang="">
  <dt>Conforms</dt>
  <dd property="sh:conforms" datatype="xsd:boolean">False</dd>
</dl>

format.name: format
format.description:
An optional 'file extension' that controls the validation report serialisation format.

Overrides the Accept request header.

dataGraphUri.name: dataGraphUri
dataGraphUri.description:
An optional URI string where the data graph is loaded from.

Overrides the dataGraphRdf parameter.

dataGraphRdf.name: dataGraphRdf
dataGraphRdf.description:
An optional RDF string representing the data graph.

Overridden by the dataGraphUri parameter.

shapesGraphUri.name: shapesGraphUri
shapesGraphUri.description:
An optional URI string where the shapes graph is loaded from.

Overrides the shapesGraphRdf parameter.

shapesGraphRdf.name: shapesGraphRdf
shapesGraphRdf.description:
An optional RDF string representing the shapes graph.

Overridden by the shapesGraphUri parameter.

validate.description:
An optional RDF document representing a graph that contains both data to be validated and SHACL shapes to validate it.

Overrides query string and form parameters.

application/rdf+xml.example:
<rdf:RDF xml:base="http://example.com/" xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#" xmlns:ex="http://example.com/" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#">
  <rdf:Description rdf:about="s">
    <ex:p rdf:resource="o"/>
  </rdf:Description>
  <rdf:Description>
    <targetNode rdf:resource="s"/>
    <property>
      <rdf:Description rdf:about="shape">
        <path rdf:resource="p"/>
        <class rdf:resource="C"/>
      </rdf:Description>
    </property>
  </rdf:Description>
</rdf:RDF>
